EXPERIENCE.TITLE: Experience in scalable application development. Freelance.

ITEMS_5.TITLE: Web Development Course with React.js
ITEMS_5.DESCRIPTION: Final project of the React course with Talento Tech: a complete online store with user authentication, persistent shopping cart, product search and filtering, consumption of a custom REST API, and protected routes. Built with React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, the application is fully responsive, optimized for Vercel, and reflects best practices in modern frontend development, global state management, and user experience.

ITEMS_4.TITLE: Node.js and Express.js Course with Firebase as Database
ITEMS_4.DESCRIPTION: Final project of the Talento Tech Node.js course: a REST API for product management that combines Firebase as the main database with a local JSON file for specific searches and updates. It implements secure authentication with JWT and is organized using routes, controllers, middlewares, and services, reflecting best practices in backend and scalable development.

ITEMS_3.TITLE: Web Development Course with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Astro and Tailwind CSS
ITEMS_3.DESCRIPTION: The Talento Tech Frontend Course is a comprehensive program that covers the fundamentals and advanced techniques of web development, focusing on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Through theoretical classes, practical examples, and exercises, students learn to build modern, responsive, and interactive web interfaces. The course includes resources such as CSS tools, Node.js configurations, and integrative projects to apply acquired knowledge. With a hands-on approach, participants develop skills to design and program efficient and attractive websites. Upon completion, they are prepared to face real-world frontend development challenges.

ITEMS_2.TITLE: Student of the University Technical Degree in Programming - UTN
ITEMS_2.DESCRIPTION: In Programming 1 and 2 at UTN, I learned the fundamentals of C++, from variables, conditionals, and loops to dynamic memory, pointers, data structures, and object-oriented programming (OOP). Throughout the semesters, the program included practical exercises, teamwork, and final integrative projects, where we applied our knowledge to solve complex problems and develop complete applications. I used standard libraries, file handling, and debugging techniques, strengthening both technical and collaboration skills. As a result, I acquired a solid foundation to design robust solutions and work efficiently in a team.

ITEMS_1.TITLE: Self-Taught Student
ITEMS_1.DESCRIPTION: Introductory C# course focused on programming fundamentals, from basic concepts such as variables and conditionals to advanced topics like functions, vectors, and matrices. Through this course, I began my journey into programming, acquiring the solid and necessary foundations to develop simple console applications. Taught by MaxiPrograma, a UTN professor.

ITEMS_7.TITLE: Modern News Website
ITEMS_7.DESCRIPTION: Modern news website project developed with Astro and TailwindCSS, designed to deliver a fast and responsive experience. It integrates MDX support, image processing with Sharp, and is fully prepared with TypeScript for scalable and secure development. Includes ready-to-use development, build, and preview configurations, along with formatting tools like Prettier and Astro-specific plugins to keep the code clean and consistent.

ITEMS_6.TITLE: Shopping Cart, Full Stack Application
ITEMS_6.DESCRIPTION: Complete online store developed as the final project of the React course at Talento Tech. The application includes user authentication, shopping cart functionality, product search, and consumption of a custom REST API, implemented with Node.js and Firebase for full catalog management.

ITEMS_5.TITLE: Gamer Event Project
ITEMS_5.DESCRIPTION: Web project for a gamer event developed with Astro, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. It includes fast and modern navigation, multilingual support (English and Spanish) with i18n, arena sections, categories, and contact pages. Fully responsive and adaptable to mobile devices, laptops, and desktops, delivering a smooth and engaging user experience.

ITEMS_4.TITLE: Motorcycle Landing Page
ITEMS_4.DESCRIPTION: The Clon-Tesla-Landing project is an example of a Tesla landing page, specifically a version for motorcycles. This project is developed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Astro, and Tailwind. Most of the code is written in Astro, with small JavaScript components and CSS styles. This project is ideal for learning how to integrate these technologies in a web application.

ITEMS_3.TITLE: Recommended Books
ITEMS_3.DESCRIPTION: This project, Recommended Books, uses technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Tailwind, and Astro. It is designed to recommend books and features a highlighted book image on its homepage. It has an organized folder structure to efficiently manage content and styles. The project uses Astro to optimize the generation of static and dynamic pages.

ITEMS_2.TITLE: Shopping Cart
ITEMS_2.DESCRIPTION: The final project of the Front End development course provided by Talento Tech aims to apply the knowledge acquired throughout the course by creating a functional and attractive website. Using technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap CSS, it delivers a modern and responsive interface that allows users to interact effectively with the platform.

ITEMS_1.TITLE: Virtual Store for Gaming PCs and Components
ITEMS_1.DESCRIPTION: This project consists of developing a virtual store for gaming PCs using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap. The main goal is to offer an intuitive and attractive user experience to explore, customize, and purchase high-performance systems designed for gaming.
